key_mistakes.reason: Failed to control the center and develop pieces effectively.
Lost control of the center and allowed Black to develop with tempo.
Missed an opportunity to simplify and improve the pawn structure.
Exposed the queen to unnecessary danger, losing tempo.
Opened lines for the opponent's pieces without sufficient preparation.
Allowed the opponent to gain a decisive attack.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center early in the game.
Develop pieces to active squares and avoid moving the same piece multiple times early on.
Maintain a solid pawn structure and avoid unnecessary pawn moves that weaken your position.
Ensure your king's safety, especially if the center is open or can be opened.
Review tactical motifs to improve calculation and avoid missed opportunities.
